subject: Leadership
title: Speaking with Presence
description: A 60-second lesson on Speaking with Presence.

hook.text: Two speakers give identical words. One captivates; the other puts them to sleep. Same content, different presence.

buildup.text: Presence is what makes people lean in. It combines confidence, authenticity, and full engagement with the moment.

discovery.text: Cuddy's research: expansive body language raises testosterone and lowers cortisol. You can physically build presence.

twist.text: Presence isn't charisma or volume. Soft-spoken leaders can command rooms. Presence is about being fully where you are.

climax.text: Build presence: pause before speaking, make eye contact, vary pace, cut filler words. Practice in low-stakes settings.

punchline.text: People forget your slides. They never forget how you made them feel.

quiz.question: What is speaking presence?
options: Being the loudest person in the room
